meanings.definition: A feeling of hatred or strong opposition
meanings.sent1: Her antagonism towards change made it difficult to adapt to new ideas.
meanings.sent2: There was a deep antagonism towards the new policy among the employees.
meanings.sent3: Despite their antagonism, they found common ground in their love for ice cream.
meanings.sent4: The antagonism in her voice was like a sharp blade cutting through the silence.
meanings.sent5: The antagonism in his eyes was unmistakable, revealing his true feelings.

meanings.definition: The opposition of one force or substance to another
meanings.sent1: The antagonism between the chemicals caused a violent reaction.
meanings.sent2: The antagonism of the wind against the sails made sailing challenging.
meanings.sent3: The antagonism of the puzzle pieces made it difficult to fit them together.
meanings.sent4: The antagonism of the waves crashing against the shore was a powerful sight.
meanings.sent5: The antagonism of the magnets repelling each other was fascinating to watch.
